Aquaculture and fish farming would become more advanced, as there would be no need to use cages to keep fish in. Fish could be raised in the wild, in nets, or in man-made underwater farms.
The environment would be easier to preserve as there would no longer be any need to build bridges or roads across rivers and oceans, which can cause habitat destruction.
The study of marine biology and ecosystem would be enhanced as there would be no barriers to research and exploration.
There would be less pollution in the ocean as there would be no need to use boats to transport people and goods.
New transportation methods, such as underwater trains and cars, could be developed, eliminating the need for bridges and tunnels.
